bit.name: Deafening To AIs
bit.tooltip: when used as a background stereo track, causes nearby AIs to be unable to hear

bit.name: Not A Loop
bit.tooltip: this is a collection of permutations strung together that should play once then stop.

bit.name: Stops Music
bit.tooltip: all other music loops will stop when this one starts.

plugin.comment: as the sound's input scale changes from zero to one, these modifiers move between the two values specified here. the sound will play using the current scale modifier multiplied by the value specified below. (0 values are ignored.)

as the sound's input scale changes from zero to one, these modifiers move between the two values specified here. the sound will play using the current scale modifier multiplied by the value specified below. (0 values are ignored.)

tagblock.name: Tracks
tagblock.tooltip: tracks play in parallel and loop continuously for the duration of the looping sound.

bit.name: Fade In At Start
bit.tooltip: the loop sound should fade in while the start sound is playing.

bit.name: Fade Out At Stop
bit.tooltip: the loop sound should fade out while the stop sound is playing.

bit.name: Fade In Alternate
bit.tooltip: when the sound changes to the alternate version, crossfade.

tagblock.name: Detail Sounds
tagblock.tooltip: detail sounds play at random throughout the duration of the looping sound.

rangef.name: Random Period Bounds
rangef.tooltip: the time between successive playings of this sound will be randomly selected from this range.

tagblock.comment: if the sound specified above is not stereo it will be randomly spatialized according to the following constraints. if both lower and upper bounds are zero for any of the following fields, the sound's position will be randomly selected from all possible directions or distances.

ranged.name: Yaw Bounds
ranged.tooltip: the sound's position along the horizon will be randomly selected from this range.

ranged.name: Pitch Bounds
ranged.tooltip: the sound's position above (positive values) or below (negative values) the horizon will be randomly selected from this range.

rangef.name: Distance Bounds
rangef.tooltip: the sound's distance (from its spatialized looping sound or from the listener if the looping sound is stereo) will be randomly selected from this range.
